dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
NLopt is a free/open-source library for nonlinear optimization,
providing a common interface for a number of different free optimization
routines available online as well as original implementations of various
other algorithms.
dependencies.name: nlopt

dependencies.description: Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python.
dependencies.name: py-deap

dependencies.description:
This package provides Python bindings for the Message Passing Interface
(MPI) standard. It is implemented on top of the MPI-1/MPI-2
specification and exposes an API which grounds on the standard MPI-2 C++
bindings.
dependencies.name: py-mpi4py

dependencies.description: A Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic.
dependencies.name: py-mpmath

dependencies.description: This package provides Python bindings for the PETSc package.
dependencies.name: py-petsc4py

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.
dependencies.name: py-psutil

dependencies.description: Data validation and settings management using Python type hinting.
dependencies.name: py-pydantic

dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.
dependencies.name: py-tomli

dependencies.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.

dependent_to.description:
Xsdk is a suite of Department of Energy (DOE) packages for numerical
simulation. This is a Spack bundle package that installs the xSDK
packages
dependent_to.name: xsdk
